subtasks: Determine the appropriate variety for the planting season
Check soil conditions and amend if necessary
Prepare seeds by shelling or leaving intact
Sow seeds at the correct depth
Transplant seedlings into the garden carefully
Hill soil around the base of the plant when it reaches a foot in height
Apply a light mulch to prevent soil crusting
Water the plants weekly, providing 1 inch of water
Monitor nitrogen fertilizer application due to the plant's ability to fix nitrogen
Check for signs of maturity, including yellowing leaves and gold-marked veins on shells
Pull or dig plants when soil is moist
Dry plants in an airy place after harvest
Remove unshelled pods for storage in airtight containers.
